Key Match Events: Sri Lanka won by 6 wickets with 9 balls remaining.
Wanindu Hasaranga took 3 wickets for 13 runs.
Dhananjaya de Silva scored 66 not out off 44 balls.
Mujeeb Ur Rahman took 2 wickets for 24 runs.
Rashid Khan took 2 wickets for 31 runs.
Lahiru Kumara bowled Rahmanullah Gurbaz in the 7th over.
Post-Match Reflections: Sri Lanka's hopes remain alive, though they are slim. They must beat England in their next game to have a chance, and other results must also go their way.
Afghanistan is out of the T20 World Cup after this loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sri Lanka kept Afghanistan's run-rate in check, conceding only 144 for 8 on a decent batting track.
Dhananjaya de Silva built a slow partnership with Kusal Mendis, ensuring Sri Lanka did not lose top-order wickets early.
De Silva's partnership with Charith Asalanka made 54 off 34 balls.
Rashid Khan twisted his knee while fielding but is expected to be fully fit soon.
